DataElement.preferredName: Radionuclide Imaging Agent Injection Start Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time the radionuclide imaging agent was injected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Radionuclide Imaging Agent Injection Route of Administration Start Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle._The time at which something is to start or did start.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Property.preferredName: Radionuclide Imaging Agent Injection Route of Administration Start Time
Property.preferredDefinition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.:The time at which something is to start or did start.

Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
The time at which something is to start or did start.
